intro: Erythraea luteola, commonly known as the yellow erythraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a slightly waxy texture, and the plant can grow up to 1 meter in height. Erythraea luteola is often found in woodland and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
